title: Terriers continue hot start
text:
Report Error 
One of Elkhornâ€™s Bowles brothers was involved in each goal on Sunday night as the Portage Terriers struck three times in the third period to top the visiting Winnipeg Blues 3-1. 
Brad Bowles set up the first goal and insurance marker. The insurance goal was scored nine seconds after the game winner, which was set up by Shawn, in their Manitoba Junior Hockey League game. 
Elsewhere, it was: Winkler Flyers 6, OCN Blizzard 1. 
On Saturday in the MJHL, it was: Blizzard 8, Neepawa Natives 1; Terriers 3, Swan Valley Stampeders 0; and Dauphin Kings 4, Wayway Wolverines 2. 
In Portage la Prairie, Chase Brakel, Nick Henry and Adam Wowryk found the back of the net as the Terriers (7-1-0) extended their winning streak to three games. Taeron Lewis replied for the Blues (3-4-1), who have dropped four in a row. 
Flyers 6 Blizzard 1 
At Winkler, Tristan Keck had two goals and a helper to pace the Flyers (6-1-1), who struck for six unanswered in the final 40 minutes. Cam Whyte of Virden had a goal and an assist for the home side. Devin Muir netted the goal for OCN (3-3-2), while Emiliem Boily stopped 43 shots in net.
